title: Does the hook man really exist?

content: Ive heard several versions of that when I was younger. One had the guy hanging from a branch above the car. Another had a guy slipping in the basement window of a house where a girl was babysitting and had let her boyfriend in after the parents left. The later was even claimed to have happened in the town near where we lived - because there was a large insane asylum nearby. . . True or not, they were grist for campfire stories during Scout outings, and usually got worse with every telling -- Wandering and Wondering
reply: Ive heard several versions of that when I was younger. One had the guy hanging from a branch above the car. Another had a guy slipping in the basement window of a house where a girl was babysitting and had let her boyfriend in after the parents left. The later was even claimed to have happened in the town near where we lived - because there was a large insane asylum nearby. . . True or not, they were grist for campfire stories during Scout outings, and usually got worse with every telling -- Wandering and Wondering

content: Lake Worth Texas has a legend on a small island, "Goat Man". Half man half goat, tried to find him/it in our younger days. But yea, I remember the man with the hook, lol... story still goes on in so many different ways now.
reply: Lake Worth Texas has a legend on a small island, "Goat Man". Half man half goat, tried to find him/it in our younger days. But yea, I remember the man with the hook, lol... story still goes on in so many different ways now.
title: Does the hook man really exist?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Ive heard several versions of that when I was younger. One had the guy hanging from a branch above the car. Another had a guy slipping in the basement window of a house where a girl was babysitting and had let her boyfriend in after the parents left. The later was even claimed to have happened in the town near where we lived - because there was a large insane asylum nearby. . . True or not, they were grist for campfire stories during Scout outings, and usually got worse with every telling -- Update on the one about the guy climbing in through the basement window - it really did happen. Mystical was baby-sitting in the same neighborhood a few blocks from the crime. The guy crawled in the basement window, waited for the boyfriend to leave then proceeded to rape and kill the girl in the same room with the baby... The guy was not caught immediately so an immediate bulletin was put out on the three TV stations and the few radio stations that existed back then around here, and Mystical's parents came over to set with her until the parents came home. The maniac was caught shortly thereafter. We were both 12 at the time. Probably heard about it on one of the scouting trips that summer, maybe from her brother, and just thought it was a made-up scary tale - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Ive heard several versions of that when I was younger. One had the guy hanging from a branch above the car. Another had a guy slipping in the basement window of a house where a girl was babysitting and had let her boyfriend in after the parents left. The later was even claimed to have happened in the town near where we lived - because there was a large insane asylum nearby. . . True or not, they were grist for campfire stories during Scout outings, and usually got worse with every telling --
reply: Update on the one about the guy climbing in through the basement window - it really did happen. Mystical was baby-sitting in the same neighborhood a few blocks from the crime. The guy crawled in the basement window, waited for the boyfriend to leave then proceeded to rape and kill the girl in the same room with the baby... The guy was not caught immediately so an immediate bulletin was put out on the three TV stations and the few radio stations that existed back then around here, and Mystical's parents came over to set with her until the parents came home. The maniac was caught shortly thereafter. We were both 12 at the time. Probably heard about it on one of the scouting trips that summer, maybe from her brother, and just thought it was a made-up scary tale - - Wandering and Wondering

title: Does the hook man really exist?

content: Interesting notion the story was created to keep the kids from watching the "submarine races". I grew up with the Hook story but the version was the guy hanging from a branch, scratching the top of the car as he was swaying To back-up the story we have a Bellevue, PA which I'm guessing got it's "mental hospital" portion of the stories from the old old facility in NY. I grew up with a bigger fear of the Jersey Devil and Bigfoot. Sitting in a cabin in the middle of the Pine Barrens, hearing about a creature just outside!! Intriguing how east and west coast have similar stories. I got over my fear of Bigfoot after Harry & the Henderson's choose joy each day

On the other hand the little people out there told him they didnt believe in him eather, most of them got away but he did have to pick a few out from between his toes, he also said he was just gonna stay here in Oklahoma, getting to crowded in the citys. oh well guess we will just have another beer aaaaa coffiee, ya all have a wonderful day D.J. Just one more thing Mr. foot (he is shy about being called Big Foot) says not to worry about the man with the hook, He says the stupid fella tryed to go fishing and got it hooked into about a 120 lb. spoonbill catfish and lost it. On the other hand the little people out there told him they didnt believe in him eather, most of them got away but he did have to pick a few out from between his toes, he also said he was just gonna stay here in Oklahoma, getting to crowded in the citys. oh well guess we will just have another beer aaaaa coffiee, ya all have a wonderful day D.J. Just one more thing Mr. foot (he is shy about being called Big Foot) says not to worry about the man with the hook, He says the stupid fella tryed to go fishing and got it hooked into about a 120 lb. spoonbill catfish and lost it. Mr Foot dont think he can afford a replacement hook . This message has been edited. Last edited by: donniejanuarysr, Fri 10 April 2009 11:09 AM
quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: quote: Originally posted by MissU2: Interesting notion the story was created to keep the kids from watching the "submarine races". I grew up with the Hook story but the version was the guy hanging from a branch, scratching the top of the car as he was swaying To back-up the story we have a Bellevue, PA which I'm guessing got it's "mental hospital" portion of the stories from the old old facility in NY. I grew up with a bigger fear of the Jersey Devil and Bigfoot. Sitting in a cabin in the middle of the Pine Barrens, hearing about a creature just outside!! Intriguing how east and west coast have similar stories. I got over my fear of Bigfoot after Harry & the Henderson's Now that was a good movie. I keep an open mind in the woods. More likely to run into a wolf or cougar than Bigfoot. though.
reply: I was having a cup of coffiee with bigfoot this morning and told him what you said about him, think it hurt his feelings. He said to tell ya just for that he wasnt gonna look in your window anymore. On the other hand the little people out there told him they didnt believe in him eather, most of them got away but he did have to pick a few out from between his toes, he also said he was just gonna stay here in Oklahoma, getting to crowded in the citys. oh well guess we will just have another beer aaaaa coffiee, ya all have a wonderful day D.J. Just one more thing Mr. foot (he is shy about being called Big Foot) says not to worry about the man with the hook, He says the stupid fella tryed to go fishing and got it hooked into about a 120 lb. spoonbill catfish and lost it. Mr Foot dont think he can afford a replacement hook . This message has been edited. Last edited by: donniejanuarysr, Fri 10 April 2009 11:09 AM
title: Does the hook man really exist?

content: Does the Hookman exist? Yeah, I do. But I quit going out in public after I finally got a date with a mermaid. She may be cold and wet, but she sure can wriggle. These are my opinions. Yours may differ.
